thread.title: Trinity, Heritage to clash in GISA Final 4
thread.title_full: Trinity, Heritage to clash in GISA Final 4

title: Trinity, Heritage to clash in GISA Final 4
text:
Trinity, Heritage to clash in GISA Final 4 Saturday, October 24, 2015 Comments 
For the fifth consecutive year, Coweta County will have a representative in the GISA State Volleyball Championship. 
Both defending four-time champion Trinity Christian and tournament host Heritage School advanced to the Final Four for the second consecutive season on Friday, defeating a pair of opponents in equally impressive fashion to set up a semifinal date between the rivals today at 2:30 p.m. 
The Lady Lions and Lady Hawks finished second and third, respectively out of Region 1-AAA. Unlike last year’s tournament, where Trinity and Heritage advanced on opposite sides of the bracket, the county rivals will face each other in the Final Four for the first time. 
The winner of today’s 2:30 p.m., match will immediately advance to the best-of-5 GISA State Championship. 
Trinity’s lineup, which includes five seniors, improved to 32-4 this season after defeating Holy Spirit and Region 2 champion Val- wood, which entered Friday undefeated. 
Heritage School, meanwhile, advanced with victories over Dominion Christian and Region 4 champion Augusta Prep. 
Looming on the other side of the state bracket is Oak Mountain, which also returned to this year’s GISA Final Four after finishing as runner-up to Trinity Christian in 2014. 
Oak Mountain had handed the Lady Lions two of their four losses this season. More
